title: Boston Family Days / Boston Family Museum

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Boston Family Days / Boston Family Museum
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to M.G.L. c. 66, § 10, I request copies of all records relating to any actual, proposed, draft, interim, or contemplated agreement or arrangement between the City of Boston (including any department, office, or agency) and the Boston Family Days / Boston Family Museum, including but not limited to:

1. All draft agreements, whether complete or incomplete, including all versions and revisions.


2. Any memoranda of understanding, term sheets, letters of intent, side letters, or informal written arrangements, whether draft or final.


3. All emails, attachments, and correspondence discussing proposed terms, scope, obligations, indemnification, insurance, licensing, access, or use of City property.


4. Internal City records reflecting approval, review, negotiation, or authorization of any such arrangement, whether or not a final agreement was executed.


5. Any documents reflecting an agreement in principle, course of dealing, or operational understanding, regardless of whether the documents are labeled as an “agreement.”



This request includes records in draft form and records that were never finalized or executed.

If any portion of the requested records is withheld, please provide a detailed exemption log identifying each record withheld or redacted, the specific statutory exemption claimed, and a brief explanation of how the exemption applies.

If no responsive records exist for any category above, please confirm that fact in writing and identify the custodians and systems searched.

Please provide the records electronically. If fees are anticipated, please provide a detailed written fee estimate before proceeding.

Thank you.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Post-Inspection Communications)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Post-Inspection Communications)
communications.communication:
Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I request copies of all public records held by the Michigan Department of Agriculture and Rural Development from November 1, 2025 to present relating to Five Below, Inc., other than routine inspection reports already produced.

Specifically, this request seeks:

Any communications (emails, letters, memoranda, notes) between MDARD staff and Five Below, Inc. or its representatives following inspection findings

Any communications between MDARD and the Michigan Department of Attorney General referencing Five Below, Inc., Scanner Law compliance, or post-inspection status

Any internal MDARD communications discussing Five Below’s compliance, remediation, persistence, or repeat inspection outcomes

This request is not intended to duplicate previously produced inspection reports, but to identify any related communications or records created outside of the inspection reports themselves.

If no such records exist, please confirm that fact in writing.

Records in electronic format are requested where available.

title: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Scanner Law Compliance Records)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Scanner Law Compliance Records)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of public records held by the Michigan Department of Attorney General from November 1, 2025 to present that reference or relate to Five Below, Inc. and Michigan Scanner Law (MCL 445.353 et seq.) compliance.

This request is limited to records that include one or more of the following:

Any written assurances, representations, remediation descriptions, or compliance statements made by Five Below, Inc. or its representatives to the Attorney General’s Office following the November 2025 Notice of Intended Action.

Any agreements, settlement discussions, assurances of voluntary compliance (AVC), assurances of discontinuance (AOD), corrective action frameworks, or compliance plans (formal or informal), including drafts.

Any correspondence (emails, letters, memoranda) between the Attorney General’s Office and Five Below, Inc. or its legal counsel regarding Scanner Law pricing compliance or remediation after December 15, 2025.

Any internal Attorney General communications that evaluate, summarize, or reference Five Below’s post-notice compliance status.

This request does not seek investigative strategy or attorney work product beyond what is required to be disclosed under FOIA.

Records may be provided electronically. If any portion is withheld, please identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon.

I request a waiver of fees as the records are sought in the public interest and for informational purposes.

Thank you for your assistance.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia State University Policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of VSU Student Honor Code/Code of Ethics covering lying, cheating, stealing, plagiarism, etc.  
2. A copy of VSU Student Honor/Code of Ethics System detailing how violations of the Honor Code/Student Code of Ethics relating to lying, cheating, stealing, plagiarism, etc. are reported, charged, adjudicated with the range of sanctions and who receives reports and conducts the adjudication.
3. ROTC Commissioning rates by service from 2019 to present by race and gender.
4. Admissions policies, including any diversity goals or objectives by race and gender.
5. Copy of VCU's DEI policy and trainings, as well as whether student attendance is required.
6. Admissions data, including applications, acceptances, enrollment by race and gender from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
7. Student retention data by class, race, and gender, from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
8. Amount of funding received from the Virginia State University Alumni Association, VCU Foundation or related alumni groups, funds and/or endowments in total and as a percentage of the University's overall funding from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
9. Any current concept papers or planning documents, reports or other matrials on the subject of the VSU BOV taking over governance f the Virginia Military Institute

The requested records are reasonably believed to be immediately available within existing records and, therefore, should be provided within the 5-day statutory requirement under the Virginia FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: DARPA: Atomic Machines, Inc. Contracts and OTA Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DARPA: Atomic Machines, Inc. Contracts and OTA Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records relating to contracts, grants, and "Other Transaction Authority" (OTA) agreements between DARPA and Atomic Machines, Inc. (https://www.atomicmachines.com) (DUNS: 117144907; CAGE Code: 8D7X8) or any subsidiary.

Specifically, I am requesting:

Agreement Documentation: Copies of all awarded contracts, grant agreements, and Other Transaction (OT) agreements (including Research OTs under 10 U.S.C. § 4021 and Prototype OTs under 10 U.S.C. § 4022).

Proposals & White Papers: A copy of the technical proposal or white paper submitted by Atomic Machines, Inc. in response to any DARPA Broad Agency Announcement (BAA) or Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR/STTR) solicitation.

Evaluations & Rejections: In cases where a proposal was submitted but not awarded, provide the "Technical Evaluation" and "Selection/Non-Selection" letters.

Statements of Work (SOW): Detailed SOWs or "Milestone Schedules" that describe the specific MEMS fabrication capabilities or "Matter Compiler" benchmarks the company is contracted to deliver.

Communications: All correspondence (emails, letters, meeting minutes) between Jeff Holden or Klaus Zietlow (CTO) and DARPA Program Managers regarding the "foundational" or "dual-use" applications of their technology.

If certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for DARPA's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Officers and Reports on 2025-6-19
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All officers involved related to the following law enforcement critical incident:

Incident Date: June 19th 2025 9:00 PM - 10:00 PM
Location: 130 S Nevada Ave, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
Victim Name: Forrest Andrew

I am specifically requesting any and all names, badge numbers, and/or police reports of officers involved in the incident above

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessie Proffitt
